tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 日子八井命（ひこやいのみこと、生没年不詳）は、日本神話に登場する日本の皇族。
sen.e: Hikoyai no mikoto (日子八井命, year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who appears in the Japanese Myth.
sen.cmt: 次に、違う漢字で「ひこやいのみこと」を示すものが出るので、ここでは漢字表記も並記しました。
sen.e: Hikoyai no mikoto (日子八井命, year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who appears in the Japanese Myth.
Hikoyai no mikoto (日子八井命, year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who appears in the Japanese Myth.

sen.j: 彦八井耳命・彦八井命・武国竜命・高知保神。
sen.e: He is also referred to as 彦八井耳命 (Hikoyai mimi no mikoto), 彦八井命 (Hikoyai no mikoto), 武国竜命,高知保神 (Takachiho no kami).
sen.cmt: 武国竜命は読み方不明。高知保神は正しい読み方が不明です（推測で記入）。
sen.e: He is also referred to as 彦八井耳命 (Hikoyai mimi no mikoto), 彦八井命 (Hikoyai no mikoto), 武国竜命, 高知保神 (Takachiho no kami).
He is also referred to as 彦八井耳命 (Hikoyai mimi no mikoto), 彦八井命 (Hikoyai no mikoto), 武国竜命, 高知保神 (Takachiho no kami).

sen.j: 『古事記』によれば、初代神武天皇の皇子である。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), he was a prince of the first emperor of Japan, the Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), he was a prince of the first emperor of Japan, the Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), he was a prince of the first emperor of Japan, the Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 母は大物主神の女・伊須気余理比売である。
sen.e: His mother was Isukeyorihime, a daughter of Omononushi no kami.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；原文に「ヒメタタライスズヒメ」とあるのはリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると「伊須気余理比売」となっているので、これで訳出しました。
sen.e: His mother was Isukeyorihime, a daughter of Omononushi no kami.
His mother was Isukeyorihime, a daughter of Omononushi no kami.

sen.j: 同母弟に神八井耳命・綏靖天皇がいる。
sen.e: His maternal half-brothers were Kamuyaimimi no mikoto and the Emperor Suizei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His maternal half-brothers were Kamuyaimimi no mikoto and the Emperor Suizei.
His maternal half-brothers were Kamuyaimimi no mikoto and the Emperor Suizei.

sen.j: しかし、『日本書紀』には日子八井命の名は無く、『新撰姓氏録』・『阿蘇氏系図』では神八井耳命の子となっている。
sen.e: However, Hikoyai no mikoto is not described in the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan); and according to the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) and the "Aso-shi Keizu" (The Family Tree of Aso clan), Hikoyai no mikoto is referred to as a son of Kamuyaimimi no mikoto.

However, Hikoyai no mikoto is not described in the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan); and according to the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) and the "Aso-shi Keizu" (The Family Tree of Aso clan), Hikoyai no mikoto is referred to as a son of Kamuyaimimi no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: However, Hikoyai no mikoto is not described in the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan); and according to the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) and the "Aso-shi Keizu" (The Family Tree of Aso clan), Hikoyai no mikoto is referred to as a son of Kamuyaimimi no mikoto.

sen.j: 菅原道真と共に大阪府門真市・堤根神社の祭神として祀られている。
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity in Tsutsumine-jinja Shrine (Kadoma City, Osaka Prefecture) together with SUGAWARA no Michizane.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity in Tsutsumine-jinja Shrine (Kadoma City, Osaka Prefecture) together with SUGAWARA no Michizane.
He is enshrined as a deity in Tsutsumine-jinja Shrine (Kadoma City, Osaka Prefecture) together with SUGAWARA no Michizane.

sen.j: その他、野口神社（奈良県御所市）・草部吉見神社（熊本県阿蘇郡高森町 (熊本県)）でも祀られ、国龍神・草部吉見神とも呼ばれている。
sen.e: Adding to that, he is also enshrined in Noguchi-jinja Shrine (Gose City, Nara Prefecture) and Kusakabe yoshimi-jinja Shrine (Takamori-machi, Aso-gun, Kumamoto Prefecture) and is also called Kunitatsu no kami or Kusakabe yoshimi no kami.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Adding to that, he is also enshrined in Noguchi-jinja Shrine (Gose City, Nara Prefecture) and Kusakabe yoshimi-jinja Shrine (Takamori-machi, Aso County, Kumamoto Prefecture) and is also called Kunitatsu no kami or Kusakabe yoshimi no kami.

Adding to that, he is also enshrined in Noguchi-jinja Shrine (Gose City, Nara Prefecture) and Kusakabe yoshimi-jinja Shrine (Takamori-machi, Aso County, Kumamoto Prefecture) and is also called Kunitatsu no kami or Kusakabe yoshimi no kami.

sen.j: 『古事記』は茨田連（まむたのむらじ）・手島連の祖としている。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki", he is considered as an ancestor of Mamuta no muraji and Teshima no muraji (手島連) clans.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；「手島連」の読み方は分かるものの、次の段で違う漢字で書かれているものがあるので、こちらも漢字を併記しています。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," he is considered as an ancestor of the Mamuta no muraji and Teshima no muraji (手島連) clans.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、カンマの位置を移動、an ancestor of theとしました。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," he is considered as an ancestor of the Mamuta no muraji and Teshima no muraji (手島連) clans.

sen.j: 『新撰姓氏録』は茨田宿禰・茨田連・下家連（しもやけのむらじ）・江首（えのおびと）・尾張部（おわりべ）・豊島連（てしまのむらじ）の祖としている。
sen.e: According to the "Shinsen Shojiroku", he is considered as an ancestor of Mamuta no sukune, Mamuta no muraji, Shimoyake no muraji, Eno obito, Owaribe, Teshima no muraji (豊島連) clans.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；豊島連について上記参照ください。
sen.e: According to the "Shinsen Shojiroku," he is considered as an ancestor of the Mamuta no sukune, Mamuta no muraji, Shimoyake no muraji, Eno obito, Owaribe, Teshima no muraji (豊島連) clans.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、カンマの位置を移動、an ancestor of theとしました。
sen.e: According to the "Shinsen Shojiroku," he is considered as an ancestor of the Mamuta no sukune, Mamuta no muraji, Shimoyake no muraji, Eno obito, Owaribe, Teshima no muraji (豊島連) clans.
